summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 22, 2020, discussing the imminent arrest and charging of Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the planned charges, her suspected location in Massachusetts, and coordination between FBI personnel regarding the arrest strategy and follow-up interviews.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the FBI is in the process of charging her and planning her arrest. She is suspected to be in Massachusetts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in a question from 'the DD' asking about the status of the Epstein investigation and what remains to be done.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: The author providing updates on the Maxwell charging process, planned arrest, and investigative details such as her suspected location and phone tracking.

connections.description: Maxwell is being charged in connection with the Epstein case, specifically with conspiracy to entice minors and conspiracy to transport minors, indicating an alleged conspiratorial relationship.
The SSA is leading the investigation, coordinating the charges, arrest plan, and location tracking for Maxwell.

events.title: Planning for Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: FBI personnel discuss via email the process of charging Maxwell, moving up the arrest timeline from August to within the next few weeks, and planning to track her via GPS after obtaining an arrest warrant.

events.title: SDNY Conference Call on Maxwell Case
events.description: A conference call is scheduled with the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to discuss accelerating the arrest timeline for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: OCONUS (Outside Continental United States - mentioned as a presumption)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell in June 2020, considering moving the arrest date up from August to within weeks.
Planned charges against Maxwell included conspiracy to entice minors, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of minors, and perjury.
Investigators believed Maxwell was in Massachusetts, quarantining at a boyfriend's house, and had identified two possible mobile phones to track via GPS upon obtaining an arrest warrant.
The email chain indicates high-level coordination within the FBI and with SDNY prosecutors regarding the arrest strategy and post-arrest investigative travel.
